description: California Nebula in HaRGB - Starless version ------------------------- This is the starless version of the image I was able to capture back in November/December 2019. It is the result of 12 hours of combined Ha + RGB colour data on this enormous emission nebula, which is located ~1500 light years away from us. It was produced using the Starnet++ software. The original image can be found here: The Ha-only version of it can be found here: I don't usually do starless images, but sometimes they can be very impressive and show a clearer definition of the details of the nebulosity. ------------------------- Total imaging time: 12 hours (90x300" in H-alpha + 90x180" in colour) Telescope: Sky-Watcher Evostar ED80 Black Diamond Camera: ZWO ASI294MC Pro Mount: Celestron AVX
title: California Nebula in HaRGB - Starless version
